titles.title: To amend the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 to permit Malcolm Baldrige National Quality Awards to be made to nonprofit organizations.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Science.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Environment, Technology, and Standards.
Subcommittee on Environment, Technology, and Standards Discharged.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Science. H. Rept. 108-419.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 241.

action.text: Ms. Hart moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3389.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 408 - 0 (Roll no. 36).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.
Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation discharged by Unanimous Consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 10/5/2004--Public Law. Amends the Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 to add qualifying nonprofit organizations as a category of organizations eligible for Malcolm Baldrige National Quality Awards.
